intro: Cieca gardneri, commonly known as the Gardner's cieca, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually small and colorful, appearing in clusters during the warmer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Cieca gardneri is considered a vulnerable species.
